sentence.Network_en: You need to grill the tomatoes until the skins blacken.
sentence.Network_cn: 你得把番茄烤到皮变黑为止。

sentence.Network_en: They're trying to blacken our name.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们企图败坏我们的名声。

sentence.Network_en: Don't blacken my name by spreading rumors.
sentence.Network_cn: 不要散播流言,破坏我的名誉.

entry.def: To blacken something means to make it black or very dark in colour. Something that blackens becomes black or very dark in colour.

example.ex: The married women of Shitamachi maintained the custom of blackening their teeth...
example.tran: 下町的已婚女性还保留着把牙齿涂黑的习俗。

example.ex: You need to grill the tomatoes until the skins blacken.
example.tran: 你得把番茄烤到皮变黑为止。

entry.def: If someone blackens your character, they make other people believe that you are a bad person.

example.ex: He accused him of knowingly spreading falsehoods in an effort to blacken my character...
example.tran: 他指控他蓄意散布虚假信息以玷污我的人格。

example.ex: They're trying to blacken our name.
example.tran: 他们企图败坏我们的名声。

means.word_mean: 2. burn slightly and superficially so as to affect color;

sentences.sentence: "The fire charred the ceiling above the mantelpiece"

auth_sentence.content: Jowls sag and under-eyes blacken, to which I would add: cavernous pores in the wake of sleeping in slap.
auth_sentence.res_content: Jowls sag and under-eyes blacken, to which I would add: cavernous pores in the wake of sleeping in slap.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Jowls sag and under-eyes blacken, to which I would add: cavernous pores in the wake of sleeping in slap.

auth_sentence.content: They watched the hollows blacken as the shadows pushed the sunlight farther and farther up the side of the mountain.
auth_sentence.res_content: They watched the hollows blacken as the shadows pushed the sunlight farther and farther up the side of the mountain.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They watched the hollows blacken as the shadows pushed the sunlight farther and farther up the side of the mountain.

sentences.en: His face was blackened with coal.
The sky blackened and soon it began to rain.
sentences.cn: 天空乌云密布, 很快便下起雨来。

sentences.en: Don’t blacken my name by spreading rumors.
sentences.cn: 不要散播流言,破坏我的名誉。
